# Introduction

This template demonstrates some of the basic latex you'll need to know to create a JSS article.


# Code formatting

Don't use markdown, instead use the more precise latex commands:

* \proglang{Java}
* \pkg{plyr}
* \code{print("abc")}
*  We use R \citep{rcoreteamLanguageEnvironmentStatistical2018}. natbib is the latex reference package here...
 
# R code

Can be inserted in regular R markdown blocks.

```{r}
x <- 1:10
x
```

# Add Figure References to the document. 

```{r figs, echo=FALSE, fig.width=7,fig.height=6,fig.cap="\\label{fig:dens} plotting example"}
par(mfrow=c(2,2))
plot(1:10, col=2)
plot(density(runif(100, 0.0, 1.0)))
plot(runif(100, 0.0, 1.0),type="l")
```
Don't say Figure 1, instead use a figure label ... In Figure \ref{fig:dens}, ...
